intro: Asyneuma repandum, commonly known as the creeping sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial that forms dense mats of foliage, with small, fleshy, green leaves that help it conserve water. The plant produces yellow flowers in late spring to early summer, which are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Asyneuma repandum is adapted to harsh environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native range.
